Kalau hotel cuma mengandalkan 'berlokasi di kawasan bersejarah Bandung' dan cuma mengandalkan 'bagus untuk foto2', ya begini jadinya. Waktu baru datang, mobil diarahkan ke parkiran dan barang2 diturunkan ke trolley. Parkiran penuh, jadi harus titip kunci untuk vallet parkir. Proses checkin lumayan cepat. Tapi barang lama sekali ga diantar2 ke kamar. Coba telepon receptionist tidak diangkat2. Saya susulin ke bawah, ternyata barang2 saya masih di trolley di parkiran (di luar pintu kaca depan lift) tanpa ada yang menjaga. Untung tidak ada barang yang hilang. Setelah saya complaint baru akhirnya diantar ke kamar. Yang menginap disini membawa mobil, siapkan emosi dan pikiran buat sabar. Sabar untuk cari spot parkir (itupun kalau dapat), kalau engga berarti harus vallet parkir. Dan harus sabar menunggu saat kita perlu mobil kita untuk dipakai. Padahal 1 jam sebelum jam 9 pagi saya sudah telepon ke receptionist dan bilang kalau jam 9 pagi saya mau pakai mobil jadi tolong disiapkan, karna ada keperluan penting. Sampai di lobby ternyata mobil belum ada dan menunggu mobil datang (entah vallet parkir dimana) sampai 45 menit. Sehari sebelumnya nunggu 30 menit. Berikutnya harus sabar kalau mau menggunakan akses lift. Lift kapasitasnya cuma muat untuk 4 orang (itupun udah pas2an banget ga bisa gerak). Mau turun lama, mau naik juga lama. Antri ga kelar2. Belum lagi kalau ada sesama tamu hotel yang ga tau sopan santun nyelak antrian lift. Sarapan juga berantakan sekali. Banyak tamu hotel yang baru datang, tapi makanan sudah kosong dan belum di refill. Minta omelet juga lama banget. Kamar sempitnya bukan main. Belum lagi design kamar mandi yang kurang aman. Karna ukurannya yang kecil, shower, toilet dan wastafel ga ada pembatas/sekat, jadi kalau mandi semua lantai kamar mandi basah dan sangat licin.

Untuk breakfast nya kurang variasi dan makanannya kurang enak. Untuk pelayananya bad bgt. Karna wktu itu saya bawa kendaraan roda 2. Pelayanannya lebih mengutamakan ke tamu yg bawa kendaraan roda 4. Untuk yg bwa kendaraan roda 4 disambut dan dibukakan pintu mobilnya dan dibawakan barangnya, padahal bawaannya sedikit. Sedangkan saya yg bawa mtor tidak ada sambutan bahkan barang bawaan lebih bnyk pun tidak ada yg tanya mau dibawakan atau tidak. Pada saat checkout pun karna bawa barang bnyk mau parkir sebentar depan lobby untuk naikan barang tidak diperbolehan. Kita hanya diperbolehkan parkir di samping sana yg agak jauh dri lobby. Semoga kedepannya pelayanannya ditingkatkan lagi.

Kekurangan: Jendela yang tidak bisa dibuka. Saya dapat kamar dengan view jendela gedung tua yang seram. Menurut saya, kamarnya kecil dan sempit. Ketebalan dinding dan kedap suara kamar kurang sehingga suara dari luar masih bisa terdengar dengan jelas, kurang variasi buah saat sarapan. Secara pribadi, hotel ini agak terlalu mahal karena kekurangan tersebut. Kelebihan: Menu sarapannya variatif, enak, porsinya pas, dessertnya manis pas, menu serealnya gurih dan manis. Kebersihan sangat baik, detail halus, bau harum di kamar, lift, dan lorong. Parkir valet tersedia dan petugas valet gesit. Area rooftop yang nyaman dan kolam renang yang walaupun kecil, terbayar dengan infinity pool dan pemandangan kota Bandung yang menakjubkan. Lokasi hotel dekat dengan Alun-Alun dan Braga, dalam jarak berjalan kaki. Saya punya masalah kulkas di kamar bau apek dan busuk. I recently stayed at Maison Teraskita in Bandung and it was an amazing experience! The hotel is located right in front of Alun-Alun Bandung and just a short walk away from Braga street, which is very convenient for exploring the city. Upon arriving at the hotel, I was immediately impressed by the beautiful lobby and the friendly service provided by the staff. The check-in process was quick and efficient, and the staff was very accommodating to our needs. Our double bed classic room was decent for the price we paid (around Rp 600,000 per night including breakfast). The bed was comfortable, and the sofa with the window was a nice touch. The room was clean and well-maintained, and we had everything we needed for a comfortable stay. One thing that really stood out to us was the complimentary breakfast. As budget travelers who have stayed in many hotels before, we weren't expecting much from the breakfast, but it blew our minds. The food tasted amazing and it was clear that the chef took care in preparing it. We were delighted to see a range of food options available, from pastries and coffee to traditional gorengan and even Indomie instant noodles (which my fiancÃ© and I both loved!). The only downside to our stay was the smell of cigarette smoke in the bathroom every time we turned on the exhaust. We suspect it came from other smoking-allowed rooms nearby. However, this was a minor issue that did not detract from our overall enjoyment of the hotel. Overall, we had a wonderful stay at Maison Teraskita and would definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a comfortable and affordable hotel in Bandung. The location was convenient, the staff were friendly and accommodating, and the breakfast was simply amazing. We would definitely come back for another stay!

I stayed in a very nice boutique hotel in Semarang, so when stumbled upon this hotel, I expected the same. How wrong I was. You really can't trust photos in the internet, better read the reviews carefully. Started with entering the hotel parking lot, my patience had been running out because of the space. But still, I'll try to give the pros and cons: Pros: - Service and staff. They are prompt and attentive. It was what made up the cons below. - Unique design for the interior, quite instagrammable. -They provide sensatia botanica for soap and shampoo. That was nice. -There is dolce gusto coffee machine and well stocked minibar. -Best location near many happening spots like Alun2 and Cibadak culinary night. Stay here only if location is your priority. Cons: -Parking is terrible, access around is too narrow, space can only fit around ten cars. Pls avoid if you commute with private transport. Otherwise risk your car to be scratched. -No clear sign for drop off. In my case, there was no person at the front, so I had to make another ride around the narrow driveway just to locate their drop off. -Cleanliness is very lacking. Lots of stain on the white walls, which if you put enough effort to wet wipe, it could be cleaned. Debris and dust on the floor especially around the corners. Stains and hair on the bedsheet, brown stains on toilet bowl, towels looked like they've seen better days. -Stayed in the attic room floor, there was weird smell resembled something like salted fish around the hallway. -Lack of soundproof, bad furniture arrangement. (They have electric sockets on both sides of the bed, but no side table to put your staff and gadgets while charging). -Water leaked from the sink. Yes they fixed it right away, but it really put my mood down after the parking problem. -No shower curtain, water splashed everywhere when you shower making the floor wet and slippery. Dangerous if you are with kids or elderly. I used the two bathrobes provided to line the floor to reduce the wetness. This was the thing that infuriated me the most. -They only give you one keycard, which I had no problem, if only you didn't need the card to also power the room. I had to leave my daughter in the dark when I went down to take some stuff from the car, because you also needed the card to go up on the elevator. -There was no tissue box in the room, you had to use toilet roll instead. On the second day, they didn't add another new toilet roll, I ran out of it at night around 11.00 pm, so I had to call and ask. Fantastic. With the price that I paid, there are better options somewhere else. Definitely not coming back!

The first thing I noticed, which I shouldâ€™ve taken as a sign to leave, was the disgusting smell in the corridor on my floor (the 7th floor). It smelled like sewer but I brushed it off thinking it was a one time thing (it wasnâ€™t). Then I went to our room and noticed the run down and visibly damaged and scratched door even before I entered the room. I checked out the room, beautifully styled and decorated, and the ensuite bathroom. The bathroom looked like it had not been properly cleaned in a long time. The curtain in the shower was moldy and there were brown and yellow stains on the walls of the bathroom. The towels didnâ€™t look freshly white like hotel towels usually do. They looked worn out and old. I felt disgusted and very uncomfortable in the bathroom. My own bathroom at home, the one that I personally clean by myself, looks way more hygienic than the one in this hotel. The bedroom walls also had stains and seemed dirty. It didnâ€™t look like a brand new hotel (which it was supposed to be, as the hotel website stated that it was opened in 2020). The stains on the walls reminded me of the walls in schools. There were visible stains on the bedsheets. The corners had not been dusted. The bathrobes also had stains, surprise surprise, and one of them had tears. Only one keycard was given. There was no hairdryer even though the site stated otherwise. The walls are thin and we could hear the noise from the families next door. In addition, there were no door signs to let staff know not to disturb us and enter the room. The AC is quite hot at night even though it was set to the lowest temperature already. Taking a shower was a challenge because the bathroom started to reek of sewage water and the drain was barely working, so that one could easily flood the entire bathroom. My partner and I wanted to swim but unfortunately the swimming pool was under maintenance for a whole week. Even though there were (supposed to be) two elevators, only one seemed to be working. Take into account that the pandemic began in 2020 and there shouldnâ€™t have been as many guests coming in during the first year. Yet the hotel looked like it hadnâ€™t been taken care of in a decade. The building and the decorations are very promising if only they were cleaned thoroughly. The lobby area is instagrammable and apparently this is the only thing that matters for the hotel management. Braga + very helpful and friendly staff - dirty rooms - disgusting bathroom - only one working elevator - swimming pool not working - smelly corridors - no hairdryer - no â€do not disturbâ€ or â€please cleanâ€ signs - very thin walls - lack of information about the facilities

Kali pertama berkunjung ke tempat ini. Terletak persis di kawasan Alun-Alun Bandung, di antara BRI Tower dan Gedung Jiwasraya. Maison Teraskita menempati bangunan tua dengan arsitektur khas peninggalan kolonial Belanda. Tempat ini lagi happening dan saya mengetahui tempat ini dari postingan IG story salah seorang rekan. Sehabis nonton di salah satu mall, saya sengaja datang ke tempat ini untuk menikmati makan siang yg sudah sangat terlambat (karena saya baru datang sekitar jam 16.00). Saat sy datang seperti biasa ukur suhu dulu dan dipersilakan masuk oleh petugas security. Saat sy mau masuk ke dalam bangunan, seorang staff menghampiri dan menanyakan maksud tujuan kedatangan saya. Sy sempat bingung dan sekilas seperti kehadiran saya diragukan apa mungkin penampilan terkesan biasa saja? Entahlah ... Kemudian sy menjawab bahwa saya mau makan dan menanyakan spot smoking area apakah hanya di teras / halaman luar bangunan saja atau ada yg lainnya? Ternyata hanya ada di area luar / halaman bangunan saja. Untuk melihat menu makanan dan minuman, tentu saja harus scan QR yg tersedia di meja (hal yg lumrah di masa pandemi seperti saat ini). Pilihan saya jatuh pada Nasi Sup Buntut dan segelas Hot Cafe Latte Butterscotch, sementara rekan saya memilih Nasi Goreng Buntut (bakar) dan segelas Ice Lychee Tea. Dua menu makanan yg kami pesan adalah menu andalah di tempat ini. Saya menunggu kurang lebih 15 menit sampai akhirnya pesanan sy disajikan. Terus terang, sy agak repot makannya karena ukuran mangkok sup buntut nya kecil sedangkan tulang buntut agak besar, jd repot saat harus mencungkil / memotong daging. Kemudian piring untuk nasi pun sangat kecil, bagi saya sebetulnya kurang tepat disebut piring karena bentuk tempat nasinya hanya seukuran lodor/tempat menaruh tempe/tahu. Sangat repot! Untuk rasa sup buntutnya enak, dilengkapi potongan kecil wortel dan kentang. Yang disayangkan adalah nasi putih yg disajikan dalam kondisi dingin dan keras. Tapi karena perut sudah lapar saya makan aja. Untuk Nasi Goreng Buntut nya juga cukup enak, semua bumbu terasa kecuali rasa manisnya yg terlalu oversweet, terlalu banyak kecap. Teman saya agak kepayahan dan berusaha menghabiskan nasi goreng tersebut tapi apa daya, krn terlalu manis jdnya eneg dan nasi gorengpun tidak habis. Setelah makan, kami berdua ditanyai oleh beberapa staff perihal review makanan yg kami pesan. Kamipun menjawab seperti yg sy tulis di atas. Respon yg diberikan oleh Sales Manager sangat baik, beliau bercakap langsung dengan saya mengenai feedback yg saya berikan bahkan beliau sampai memanggil Chef untuk menemui saya (jadi ga enak hati, padahal sy ga complain tapi sy menjawab krn mereka bertanya). Sebagai compliment, kami diberikan 2 potong Cheesecake (thank you loh). Oh iya, saat melakukan pembayaran, teman saya masuk ke dalam dan langsung melakukan pembayaran disana menggunakan debit card. Karena rekan sy bekerja di sebuah store yg bergerak di bidang retail dan sangat mengetahui sekali soal cara menggunakan mesin EDC dan peng-input-an, dia melihat bahwa staff yg berada di tempat pembayaran tidak menguasai alat sehingga teman saya menunggu hampir 10 menit sampai akhirnya transaksi bisa dilakukan ditambah lagi ada pesanan kami yg tidak diinput ke billing jd kami mengingatkan petugas tsb (harus jujur, kasian kl mereka rugi). So mungkin review sy bisa jd feedback untuk evaluasi kinerja ke depan dan semoga Maison Teraskita menjadi lebih baik dalam pelayanannya di masa mendatang. Well, sorry kl panjang yah namanya juga review Saya cerita berdasarkan apa yg sy lihat dan sy rasakan langsung. Buat Anda yg mau nongkrong cantik di kawasan Alun-Alun Bandung, sila mampir di Maison Teraskita, bisa sekalian juga menginap bersama rekan / keluarga.
